page.title: 07SERVICES IN PATCHWAY
page.content: The{Health Service clinic}looks after aboot 60 people a week, supplying equipment and providing services. All injuries are taken to Southmead Hospital. There used to be a{police {station}in Southsea Road,but recently a new one has been built in Filton. From there two cars and one beat officer cover the area.They deal with around a thousand crimes a year but around half of the criminals get away. {The fire station,}built in 1974,has forty personel on full time shift work.They cover a wide area to the north and west and support Southmead Fire Station. { The Post Office sorting office}work from 5.30am to noon,receiving 2,000 letters a day. {Patchway Library}is part of Avon County Library,the reference section has information about local activities
